qas.question: Which Foreign Minister would agree to meet with Stalin on to sign a secret agreement?
How long was the secret agreement between Germany and the Soviets?
Part of the secret agreement between the Germans and the Soviets included a neutral diplomatic approach when?

answers.text: either went to war against a third power

qas.question: Which Foreign Minister wouldn't agree to meet with Stalin on to sign a secret agreement?
Which Foreign Minister would disagree to meet with Stalin on to sign a secret agreement?
How long was the public agreement between Germany and the Soviets?

plausible_answers.text: either went to war against a third power

qas.question: Part of the public agreement between the Germans and the Soviets included a neutral diplomatic approach when?

plausible_answers.text: either went to war against a third power

qas.question: Part of the secret agreement between the Germans and the Soviets excluded a neutral diplomatic approach when?

context: On 22 August, one day after the talks broke down with France and Britain, Moscow revealed that <a0_0><b3_0><b4_0>Ribbentrop<b4_0/><b3_0/><a0_0/> would visit Stalin the next day. This happened while the Soviets were still negotiating with the British and French missions in Moscow. With the Western nations unwilling to accede to Soviet demands, Stalin instead entered a secret Nazi–Soviet pact. On 24 August a <a1_0><b5_0>10-year<b5_0/><a1_0/> non-aggression pact was signed with provisions that included: consultation, arbitration if either party disagreed, neutrality if <a2_0><b6_0><b7_0>either went to war against a third power<b7_0/><b6_0/><a2_0/>, no membership of a group "which is directly or indirectly aimed at the other".
